ICSU http://www.icsu.org These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 15. Tohoku University discusses potential role of Japanese universities in Future Earth http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/tohoku-university-discusses-future-earth Developing intellectual infrastructure for Future Earth in Asia ICSU ROAP participated in a high-level meeting organised by the Graduate School of Environmental Studies, Tohoku University, in Sendai, Japan on 27 January 2014, to discuss implementation of Future Earth in Asia. Sixteen other Japanese Universities from all over the country participated in the meeting and the opportunity was used to provide those present with a clear account of the development of Future Earth in Asia and identify potential opportunities for collaboration in the development of capacity for research, education and training in sustainability studies throughout the region. All participating universities have a graduate level Environmental Leadership Programme (ELP) that has been strongly supported and funded by the Government of Japan. Fumiko Kasuga the Vice President of the Science Council of Japan also participated in the discourse. The Director of ROAP provided a historical account of the development of Future Earth, its scope, progress and roles played by various institutions and organizations in Asia and elsewhere in the development of awareness and understanding about Future Earth. He provided insights considered valuable by the participants on the necessary next steps and the vital building blocks for the successful establishment of multidisciplinary integrated research in Asia that are solutions oriented for the benefit of society. Fumiko Kasuga presented a detailed update on the state of affairs in the development of the distributed secretariat to manage Future Earth at the global, regional and local contexts. Michael Norton a professor at the Graduate School presented the concept of a Future Earth Integrated Education and Research Centre that Tohoku University plans to establish. The Centre aims to play a key role in developing capacity for Future Earth in the region, building on its current ELP. Compared to the current ELP the proposed programme at the Centre will have the following additional features:

  • It will engage with multiple stakeholders in mutual learning and co-design with regard to the Centre\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds programmes and activities;
  • It aims to broaden the existing ELP focus to include agenda essential for global sustainability;
  • It will develop\ufffd\ufffd and promote educational materials and methodologies to support training programmes for Future Earth in the region;
  • It will provide opportunities for strengthening the collaborative links for research and education for global sustainability with institutions in Asia and elsewhere; and
  • It will strengthen networking among institutions providing education for sustainable development within the context of Future Earth in Asia and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

The establishment of such a centre at Tohoku University can provide an initial test-bed for ideas on how to organise the infrastructure to develop the intellectual capacity of nations in the region to meet the needs of Future Earth for co-designed, co-produced and co-disseminated scientific knowledge vital for achieving global sustainability.

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Capacity building Sustainable development Global sustainability research Earth system science Strategic planning Global environmental change Education Regional Offices 2014-01-28T15:20:00Z News Item ICSU ROAP establishes collaborative link with UNU IIGH http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/icsu-roap-establishes-collaborative-link-with-unu-iigh ICSU ROAP and United Nations University International Institute for Global Health discusses collaboration Nordin Hasan, Director of ICSU ROAP met with the Director of the United Nations University, International Institute for Global Health (UNU IIGH) on 23 August 2013\ufffd\ufffdto discuss matters of common interest in the Asia-Pacific region. Progress with the implementation of ICSU\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds new interdisciplinary science program on health and wellbeing in the changing urban environment using the systems approach was the main topic of concern to both organizations.

UNU-IIGH is well placed to collaborate on this new science program and help build capacity for system thinking in population health research and practice.\ufffd\ufffd Next month, Profs Capon and Hasan are speaking at the first international conference on\ufffd\ufffdUrban Dynamics and Health in Paris which is being organised by University Paris Ouest \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Nanterre La Defense http://www.etouches.com/ehome/ColloqueInternational2013/101190/?&language=eng

More information about the meeting with IIGH may be obtained from http://iigh.unu.edu/events/meeting-with-international-council-for-sciences-regional-office-for-asia-and-the-pacific-icsu-roap/

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Health and wellbeing Capacity building Environment Global environmental change Applied science Science for Policy Education Regional Offices 2013-08-29T08:45:00Z News Item ICSU participates in 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/icsu-participates-in-12th-pacific-science-inter-congress Announcing ICSU ROAP's contributions to the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress in Suva, Fiji ICSU will participate in the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress from 8 to 12 July 2013 in Suva, Fiji. The theme of the inter-congress is Science for Human Security and Sustainability in the Pacific Islands and Rim. Nordin Hasan, Director, ICSU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ROAP) will deliver a keynote address entitled Future Earth:: A new international platform for research on global sustainabillity. The Inter-congress is organized by the Pacific Science Association and the University of the South Pacific where it will be held. A Panel Discussion has been scheduled to discuss the implementation of Future Earth in the Pacific Island countries. Nordin will also be speaking about the ICSU initiative on urban health and wellbeing and presenting a paper written with Katrina Proust of the Australian National University on the development of pilot projects on the systems approach to urban health and wellbeing research in the Asia-Pacific region. For more details of the inter-congress, please visit http://www.psi2013.usp.ac.fj/

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Food security Sustainable development Environment Regional Offices Global sustainability research Hazards and disasters Global environmental change Ecosystems Research and development Biodiversity Health and wellbeing Scientific Associates Applied science Basic science Traditional knowledge Energy Earth system science Climate research Science for Policy Education Social sciences 2013-07-05T07:35:00Z News Item IIASA Young Scientists Summer Program 2013 http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/events/regional-events/iiasa-young-scientists-summer-program-2013 Each summer, the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), located in Schloss Laxenburg near Vienna, Austria, hosts a selected group of graduate students from around the world in its Young Scientists Summer Program (YSSP). These students work closely with an IIASA senior scientist mentor on a project proposed by the student,related to his or her graduate research, with the goal of a publishable paper. Funding is available from IIASA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds National Member Organizations for students from member countries, but students from all nations are eligible to apply, and some unrestricted fellowships are available.

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Data and information Education Basic science Applied science 2012-12-14T09:05:00Z Event 14th ICSU Regional Committee for Africa Meeting http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/events/regional-events/14th-icsu-regional-committee-for-africa-meeting The 14th meeting of the ICSU Regional Committee for Africa will be held from 13 to 15 March, 2013 in Pemba, Mozambique. The entire membership of twelve is expected to be in attendance. This Committee which gives guidance and oversight to ICSU ROA, will meet to develop strategic plans and approve the work plan of the Office.

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Data and information Education General Assembly Capacity building 2012-12-13T07:40:00Z Event Applications for Scholarships http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/events/regional-events/applications-for-scholarships As part of the Australian Government's increasing engagement and commitment in Africa, the Australia Awards in Africa (AAA) initiative promotes development in Africa through a large-scale program of development scholarships and fellowships across a range of fields, notably Mining and Natural Resource Management, as well as Agriculture and Food Security, Health, Public Policy and Water and Sanitation. AAA offers study opportunities at post-graduate level to professionals from eligible African countries. The scholarships are offered at Masters Level, for PhD studies in Agriculture, and for short professional development courses ("Short Course Awards") of up to 3 months in specialised fields. Applications for the next round of scholarships opened on September 2012, and close on the following dates:

Short Course Awards for 2013: Closing date 30 November 2012
Long-Term Awards (Masters-level Awards) for 2014: Closing date 14 December 2012
Long-Term Awards (PhD Agriculture) for 2014: Closing date 31 March 2013

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Basic science Research integrity Data and information Education Capacity building 2012-12-12T10:52:26Z Event Future Earth Regional Workshop for Africa http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/future-earth-regional-workshop-for-africa The International Council for Science, with financial support from the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) organised the Future Earth Regional Workshop for Africa, which was in Cape Town, South Africa on 31 October \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 02 November 2012. The workshop brought together about 50 global environmental change scientists from within and outside Africa. It provided a platform for these scientists and other stakeholders working on global environmental change research across disciplines to discuss and elaborate recommendations for the development of Future Earth on the continent. Discussions focused on the research priorities particularly relevant for the continent that Future Earth should address, and the governance and institutional arrangements necessary to successfully deliver Future Earth in the region.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Environment Global environmental change Data and information Education Climate research 2012-11-06T07:30:00Z News Item Dakar Declaration http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/news-centre/news/dakar-declaration The Sida funded African Regional Implementation Workshop on Hazards and Disasters took place in Dakar, Senegal from the 26 - 27 September 2012 and ended with this declaration of outcomes. Click here fro the Senegal Declaration

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Hazards and disasters Education Basic science Capacity building 2012-10-25T17:30:00Z News Item Royal Society-DFID Africa Capacity Building Initiative http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/events/regional-events/royal-society-dfid-africa-capacity-building-initiative This scheme is for scientists who want to develop collaborative research consortia between sub-Saharan Africa and a university or independent research institute in the UK. The overall aim of the scheme is to strengthen the research capacity of universities and research institutions in sub-Saharan Africa by supporting the development of sustainable research networks.

The scheme is funded by the UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Department for International Development (DFID).

\ufffd\ufffd

The objectives are to:

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd facilitate sustainable multidisciplinary partnerships between research groups in sub-Saharan Africa and the UK.

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd strengthen research and training capacity in sub-Saharan African Institutions of Higher Education through the skill transfer between the partner organisations of the research consortia.

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd produce a cadre of young, talented researchers through integrated PhD scholarships and shared supervision of post-graduate students between the UK-based and African consortia members.

For more information click here

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Capacity building Applied science Data and information Education Climate research 2012-10-04T09:10:00Z Event Call for Applicants for the SSEESS Research Links Programme 2014 http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/calls/callsfolder/royal-society-dfid-africa-capacity-building-initiative The Swedish Secretariat for Environmental Earth System Sciences SSEESS offers project planning grants aiming to facilitate the formation of North-South research consortia within global environmental change (GEC) research. FOCUS OF THE PROGRAMME As a part of its mandate SSEESS aims to strengthen the collaboration between the Swedish scientists and international programmes, initiatives and organizations within the GEC science. One of these organizations is the International Council for Science (ICSU). The focus of this grant is on Swedish collaboration with scientists within the networks of the ICSU Regional Offices in Africa, Asia and Pacific, and Latin America and Caribbean. The overall scope is to address the regional research priorities in the framework of a newly established international research initiative Future Earth. CONDITIONS

Swedish Scientists in collaboration with the developing country partner can apply for networking support of SEK 90 000, for a period of one year. The networking grant is expected to result in draft project proposals within the regional priorities. The draft proposals can subsequently be developed to project proposals endorsed by the Future Earth scientific committee and the Regional Offices of ICSU and can target funding from the research and development funding agencies.

APPLICANT

Applicants for the SSEESS-Research Links Programme are individual researchers affiliated with Swedish research institutions, who collaborate with regional scientists on regional priorities ( at least one scientist from Sweden and a partner from the region in question). Applicants from natural sciences and social sciences and humanities are all welcome to apply.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

The main applicants should have a PHD degree awarded no later than the closing date for applications in this call.

GRAND AMOUNT AND PERIOD

The grants of Swedish SEK 90 000, are awarded for a one year period from June 1st 2014.

LAST ADMISSION DATE 31 March 20014

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Capacity building Applied science Data and information Education Climate research 2012-10-04T09:10:00Z Event 24th Colloquium of African Geology (CAG24) http://www.icsu.org/icsu-africa/events/regional-events/24th-colloquium-of-african-geology-cag24 The "Colloquium of African Geology" (CAG) is a major biennial meeting organized under the auspices of the Geological Society of Africa (GSAf). Since the first colloquium in 1965, this Colloquium has been hosted by several European and African countries. The African countries that had a chance to organize this event were Swaziland, Zimbabwe, Morocco, Mozambique, Tunisia and South Africa. Based on the decision of the Geological Society of Africa (GSAf) General Assembly held on 14 January 2011 at the University of Johannesburg, South Africa (during the 23rd Colloquium), the organization of the next Colloquium of African Geology (CAG24) as well as the 14th Conference of the Geological Society of Africa and the 40th Anniversary of the Geological Society of Africa (1973\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd2013) was assigned to Ethiopia. This will be conducted at the United Nations Economic Commission Conference Center (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia from 8 to 14 January 2013. The CAG24 will be organized by the Ethiopian Geosciences and Mineral Engineering Association (EGMEA) in cooperation with governmental and non\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgovernmental organizations under the auspices of the Geological Society of Africa (GSAf). The Theme of the Conference is: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd40 Years of GSAf (1973\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd2013): Earth Sciences Solutions to African Development Challenges\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. The Second Circular presents details of the sessions, workshops, short courses, roundtables and field excursions to be held during the conference. Click here for Second Circular

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Data and information Education Basic science Capacity building 2012-09-12T05:55:00Z Event Ceremony at the Mexican Academy of Sciences http://www.icsu.org/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/activities-outreach/national-members/jose-franco-new-president-of-the-mexican-academy-of-sciences/jose-franco-new-president-of-the-mexican-academy-of-sciences During a ceremony on May 17th 2012, Jos\ufffd\ufffd Franco took over the presidency of the Mexican Academy of Sciences (AMC) from Arturo Menchaca.

The Mexican Minister for Public Education Jos\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdngel C\ufffd\ufffdrdova, the principal of the Mexican National Autonomous University (UNAM) Jos\ufffd\ufffd Narro and the President of the Mexican National Council on Science and Technology (CONACyT) Enrique Villa witnessed the change of the presidency. In his speech, Jos\ufffd\ufffd Franco stressed the importance for scientific institutions to join forces in order to gain a strategic position in the national public agenda. During the ceremony in the auditorium of the AMC, the Weizmann Prizes 2011, the prizes for the best doctoral theses in social sciences and humanities 2011, and the scholarships for Women in Humanities and Social Sciences were conferred.

Before the ceremony, the Mexican Minister for Public Education Jos\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdngel C\ufffd\ufffdrdova, the outgoing president of the AMC Arturo Menchaca \ufffd\ufffdand the incoming president of the AMC Jos\ufffd\ufffd Franco visited the offices of ICSU ROLAC, which are located on the premises of the AMC since early 2011. The Regional Director Manuel Limonta explained the mission of ICSU and its strategic approach of establishing Regional Offices to integrate scientists from developing countries into ICSU\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds programs and to reflect the scientific priorities of those countries in the themes ICSU addresses. \ufffd\ufffdHe thanked the AMC for their hospitality and Mexico for hosting and financially supporting ICSU ROLAC. The Regional Director stressed the importance of ICSU\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds National Members for the success of ICSU. Mexico has been a National Member of ICSU since its foundation in 1931, and since 1959, when it was established, the AMC assumed the membership for Mexico in ICSU. The Regional Director congratulated Jos\ufffd\ufffd Franco on his new position and expressed his wish to continue a close collaboration with the AMC under its new president.

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia Universality of Science Education Outreach 2012-07-10T15:05:00Z Page 11th Regional Committee Meeting in Ocho Rios, Jamaica http://www.icsu.org/icsu-latin-america/news-centre/news/11th-regional-committee-meeting-in-ocho-rios-jamaica On 12th and 13th April 2012, the Regional Committee for Latin America and the Caribbean of ICSU (ICSU RCLAC) held their 11th meeting in Ocho Rios, Jamaica. ICSU RCLAC meets twice a year to discuss the strategic priorities of ICSU ROLAC and to monitor the progress of the work of the Regional Office. During their 11th Meeting, the Committee welcomed the new Committee Members Anthony Clayton (Jamaica), Humberto Rodr\ufffd\ufffdguez (Colombia) and Jerson Silva (Brazil). Luiz Davidovich (Brazil) joined the Committe as new ex-officio member, liaison to the ICSU Executive Board.

The Secretariat informed the Committee about the recent outreach activities of the Regional Office, its communication strategy, as well as the projected budget for 2012, and presented the draft 2011 Annual Report. Furthermore, the Committee was informed about and discussed the outcome of the ICSU grant programme 2012, ICSU's Future Earth Initiative, ICSU's role in the context of the Rio+20 process, as well as the ICSU Sida proposal. During the Meeting, the Regional Directors of ICSU ROA, Edith Madela-Mntla, and of ICSU ROAP, Nordin Hasan,\ufffd\ufffd presented the activities and the strategic priorities of their Regional Offices.

As a work priority of ICSU ROLAC, the Committee discussed in detail the past and upcoming implementation activities of the four ICSU ROLAC scientific priority areas biodiversity, natural hazards, sustainable energy, and mathematics education.

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia Environment Education Hazards and disasters Outreach 2012-04-30T16:20:00Z News Item Visit to Vice-Rector of the University of Panama http://www.icsu.org/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/activities-outreach/national-members/visit-to-vice-rector-of-the-university-of-panama/visit-to-vice-rector-of-the-university-of-panama On 16 April 2012, Mahabir Gupta, member of the Regional Committee, and Kerstin Schmidt-Verkerk were received by the Vice-Rector of the University of Panama, Betty Ann Rowe de Catsambanis. Mahabir Gupta, member of the Regional Committee, and Kerstin Schmidt-Verkerk were received by the Vice-Rector of the University of Panama, Betty Ann Rowe de Catsambanis.

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

The University of Panama is a National Member of ICSU and has been an important partner during the establishment of the Regional Office. During the meeting, potential ways of future collaboration between the University of Panama and ICSU ROLAC were discussed.

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia International Research Collaboration Universality of Science Education 2012-04-20T01:30:00Z Page Workshop on Mathematics Education in LAC http://www.icsu.org/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/priority-areas/mathematics-education/mathematicians-on-mathematic-education-the-search-of-impact/mathematics-workshop ICSU ROLAC co-sponsored the regional workshop on mathematics education: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMatem\ufffd\ufffdticos en la Educaci\ufffd\ufffdn Matem\ufffd\ufffdtica Escolar\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd that was held in Santiago de Chile, Chile from 11-13 January, 2012. The ICSU ROLAC science plan on mathematics education in LAC concluded that in this region children are not being taught at the level they will need to live their lives and work productively, and that children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds mathematical knowledge is poor in relation to the international average.

Jos\ufffd\ufffd Antonio de la Pe\ufffd\ufffda (Mexico), Chair of ICSU RCLAC and member of the Scientific Committee of the workshop, and Patricio Felmer (Chile), member of ICSU RCLAC and member of the Organizing Committee of the workshop gave lectures during the event. The objectives of the workshop were the exchange of experiences of mathematicians involved in mathematics education, as well as the creation of networks, the identification of good practices and the analysis of the impact of already implemented initiatives in this field.

The organizing committee of the workshop is planning two follow-up activities. The next workshop is projected to take place in Mexico in 2013, the third one in Arizona, USA in 2014.

More information (in Spanish): http://www.ciae.uchile.cl/index.php?page=view_noticias&id=176

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia Universality of Science Education Interdisciplinary Bodies 2012-04-18T14:15:00Z News Item
